## **[Sum and Difference of Two Numbers](https://www.hackerrank.com/challenges/sum-numbers-c)** 
Objective<br>The fundamental data types in c are int, float and char. Today, we're discussing int and float data types.<br>The <code>printf()</code> function prints the given statement to the console. The syntax is <code>printf("format string",argument_list);</code>. In the function, if we are using an integer, character, string or float as argument, then in the format string we have to write <code>%d</code> (integer), <code>%c</code> (character), <code>%s</code> (string), <code>%f</code> (float) respectively.<br>The <code>scanf()</code> function reads the input data from the console. The syntax is <code>scanf("format string",argument_list);</code>. For ex: The <code>scanf("%d",&amp;number)</code> statement reads integer number from the console and stores the given value in variable <span style="font-size: 100%; display: inline-block;"
